overview:
Saro Cutri is a Co-Founder of Tout’d.

Saro graduated from Cornell University’s College of Engineering in 1997 with a degree in Operations Research & Industrial Engineering. Mr. Cutri spent his first 12 professional years as a bond trader at UBS Securities, ultimately rising to the rank of Managing Director and Co-Head of the Proprietary Trading Group there.

He went on to Co-Found Sirona Advisors in 2009, a finance related startup dedicated to advising clients on distressed fixed income credit and trading. After winding down that business in 2010, Saro made his first foray into internet world, Co-Founding WhichDoc.com, a physician recommendation engine driven by social circles. WhichDoc was recently named one of the Brilliant 100 Companies of 2012 by Entrepreneur magazine.

The WhichDoc team is now pivoting it’s focus away from solely servicing the medical industry to a broader social recommendation concept, Tout’d (Toutd.com).
